Class SameGameFactory

java.lang.Object
com.aoopproject.games.samegame.SameGameFactory
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameFactory
public class SameGameFactory extends Object implements GameFactory
Concrete factory for creating all necessary components for the SameGame. This factory interactively prompts for difficulty settings and then instantiates and wires together the SameGameModel, SameGameViewSwing, a generic AbstractGameController, the MouseInputStrategy, and the SameGameSoundObserver.

A single instance of HighScoreManager is created by this factory and shared with both the SameGameViewSwing (for displaying and submitting scores) and the SameGameSoundObserver (for determining if a game end resulted in a high score to play the appropriate sound).

If model creation is cancelled by the user (e.g., closing the difficulty settings dialog), game setup might be aborted, in which case setupGame() can return null.

  • Method Details

    • createModel

      public AbstractGameModel createModel()
      Creates a SameGameModel instance after prompting the user for a DifficultyLevel.
      Specified by:
      createModel in interface GameFactory
      Returns:
      A configured SameGameModel, or null if settings dialog is cancelled.

    • createViews

      public List<GameView> createViews(AbstractGameModel model)
      Creates a list of GameView instances for the SameGame. This implementation now creates and returns both a SameGameViewSwing for graphical user interaction and a SameGameViewConsole for text-based console output. Both views will observe the provided game model.

      The shared HighScoreManager is typically set on the SameGameViewSwing instance later by the setupGame() method before the view's initialize method is called by the controller. The initialize method for both views (which associates them with the model) will be called by the controller when they are added via controller.addGameView(view).

      Specified by:
      createViews in interface GameFactory
      Parameters:
      model - The AbstractGameModel that the views will observe. This model should not be null for views to be created meaningfully.
      Returns:
      A list containing a SameGameViewSwing instance and a SameGameViewConsole instance. Returns an empty list if the provided model is null.

    • createController

      public AbstractGameController createController()
      Creates a generic AbstractGameController. Assumes AbstractGameController is a concrete class or has a suitable concrete subclass.
      Specified by:
      createController in interface GameFactory
      Returns:
      A new AbstractGameController.

    • createInputStrategy

      public InputStrategy createInputStrategy()
      This method from the GameFactory interface is not directly used by this factory's overridden setupGame() method for creating MouseInputStrategy, as that strategy requires a controller instance which is handled within setupGame.
      Specified by:
      createInputStrategy in interface GameFactory
      Returns:
      This implementation throws an UnsupportedOperationException.

    • setupGame

      public AbstractGameController setupGame()
      Sets up the complete SameGame application with a Swing UI and relevant components. This method orchestrates the creation and wiring of:
      1. A shared HighScoreManager.
      2. The SameGameModel (which prompts for difficulty).
      3. The AbstractGameController, linking it with the model.
      4. The SameGameViewSwing, providing it with the shared HighScoreManager, and adding it to the controller (which also initializes the view with the model).
      5. The MouseInputStrategy, linking it to the controller and initializing it with the SameGameViewSwing instance.
      6. The SameGameSoundObserver, providing it with the shared HighScoreManager and registering it with the model.
      If model creation is cancelled by the user (e.g., by closing the difficulty settings dialog), this method will return null, signaling that the game setup should be aborted.
      Specified by:
      setupGame in interface GameFactory
      Returns:
      A fully configured AbstractGameController ready to start SameGame, or null if the game setup was aborted.
